title: Amazing Race Contestants Pair with Complete Strangers in Season 29 — Watch the First 2 Minutes of the First Episode!
text:
Â 
The Amazing Race is headed into uncharted territory â€” and PEOPLE has an exclusive sneak peek at the first two minutes of the CBS reality competitionâ€™s new season.
â€œToday, in an Amazing Race first, 22 complete strangers are meeting each other for the first time â€” at the starting line,â€ host Phil Keoghan says in the clip from the season 29 premiere, which will air March 30.
Addressing the new contestants, Keoghan, 49, primes the strangers for their new adventure.
â€œWelcome to Grand Hope park in downtown Los Angeles, the start of an amazing race unlike any race weâ€™ve ever had before. This is all about first impressions, so take a really good look at the people standing around you â€Ś because you are about to pair up with a complete stranger for a nine-country, 17-city, 36,000 mile race around the world.â€
Some contestants welcome the change in concept. (The series traditionally casts pairs of contestants with pre-existing relationships, though the show has experimented with random pairings in the past.)
FROM COINAGE: The Most Expensive TV Shows of All Time 
â€œIt doesnâ€™t even matter who you pair me up with,â€ says Shamir Arzeno, a 28-year-old banker from Bronx, New York. â€œIâ€™m gonna throw them on my shoulder and make sure that we win.â€
But others seem to be worried about which contestant theyâ€™ll end up traveling with around the world.
â€œI really donâ€™t want to be partners with the Asian Barbie,â€ Jessie Lynn Shields, a 28-year-old K-9 police officer from Howland, Ohio, says of fellow contestant Jenn Lee. â€œSheâ€™s only here because she thinks she looks good.â€
And while that might be true, the â€œAsian Barbieâ€ has a game plan.
â€œIâ€™ll definitely use my looks to my advantage to win the race and the $1 million,â€ says Lee, a 25-year-old model from Southern California.
Before the end of the clip, Keoghan sends the contestants â€” who have yet to be paired up â€” off on their first challenge of the season.
Season 29 of The Amazing Race premieres Thursday, March 30 at 10 p.m. ET on CBS.
